dataIdInfo.idAbs: The exit layer is comprised of points containing exit number and direction attribution.

citeinfo.title: Exit Points (XIT)
citeinfo.onlink: Please enter file location path here.

descript.abstract: The exit layer is comprised of points containing exit number and direction attribution.
descript.supplinf: Exit sourcing is only available for the provinces of British Columbia, New Brunswick, Nova Scotia, Ontario and Quebec. Only a certain number of the highways, usually carto 1 designations, have exit numbers associated with them. There are approximately 2900 exit points across Canada. Exit number information was compiled from paper maps and publications printed by various transportation sources. Information such as exit numbers and source IDs were recorded from these sources. The Exit layer is comprised of label points that are associated with specific intersections as outlined by all available sources. These points were snapped into location, using the CanMap street files as a backdrop, to indicate the meeting point of the three or more line segments at that intersection – usually where an off ramp and highway meet.
descript.purpose: To create a nation-wide point based layer consisting all highway exit numbers to enhance the CanMap Streetfiles and CanMap Routelogistics products

dataLineage.statement: Exit sourcing is only available for the provinces of British Columbia, New Brunswick, Nova Scotia, Ontario and Quebec. Only a certain number of the highways, usually carto 1 designations, have exit numbers associated with them. There are approximately 2900 exit points across Canada. Exit number information was compiled from paper maps and publications printed by various transportation sources. Information such as exit numbers and source IDs were recorded from these sources. The Exit layer is comprised of label points that are associated with specific intersections as outlined by all available sources. These points were snapped into location, using the CanMap street files as a backdrop, to indicate the meeting point of the three or more line segments at that intersection – usually where an off ramp and highway meet.
